label: 役
本: The Lumber Industry in Early Modern Japan . University of Hawai'i Press . 1995
説明文: The term yaku (like the older term shiki) denotes a reciprocal relationship that embodies the two English concepts of right" and "duty" and seems usefully translated as "function."  The wood-cutting function was known as soma yaku or yama yaku, as well as ono yaku (p. 134). [職、杣役、山役、斧役] "
